Title: UK’s Centrica signs gas deals with US’s Coterra for 10 years
Description: British utility Centrica and US gas producer Coterra Energy have signed two gas sales and purchase agreements, which will reduce market risk in Centrica's LNG portfolio.
Author: JS

Title: Work underway to retire North West Shelf LNG’s Train 2 this quarter: Woodside
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has begun work to take offline the second of its five LNG trains at the 16.9 mtpa North West Shelf LNG plant in Western Australia during this quarter to manage costs and emissions amid declining production from its original gas fields.
Author: CK

Title: Vienna-headquartered MS Galleon Group seeks natural gas supply for three years, starting in 2026
Description: Vienna-headquartered international holding company MS Galleon Group is looking to procure its entire annual natural gas requirement for a three-year period starting from Jan. 1, 2026, until Dec. 31, 2028, and has issued a request for information on supply options.
Author: CK

Title: Equinor to acquire all of EQT’s non-working interest in North Marcellus gas assets in the US
Description: Norway’s state-owned energy firm Equinior has agreed to acquire all of the remaining non-operated interest in the US Northern Marcellus formation held by US natural gas producer EQT for $1.25 billion,  increasing its average working interest in the Northern Marcellus asset from 25.7% to 40.7% and strengthening its gas portfolio.
Author: CK
